Package view

Class AnchorPaneNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.Node
      • javafx.scene.Parent
        • javafx.scene.layout.Region
          • javafx.scene.layout.Pane
            • javafx.scene.layout.AnchorPane
              • view.AnchorPaneNode
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
    public class AnchorPaneNode
extends javafx.scene.layout.AnchorPane
    AnchorPaneNode holds the information of the lesson.This is the brain of the lesson being capable to add ,edit as well as book on click.This is a class that extends AnchorPane, so it can hold information.This AnchorPane will contain text as well as a certain styling when it's set by the view to visualize a lesson.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class javafx.scene.layout.Region

      • addALesson

        public void addALesson​(Course userInputForCourse,
                       Teacher userInputForTeacher,
                       java.lang.String userInputForStart,
                       java.lang.String userInputForStartMin,
                       java.lang.String userInputForEnd,
                       java.lang.String userInputForEndMin)
        This method validates the user input and if the user input is correct then it adds the lesson to the schedule
        Parameters:
        userInputForCourse - user input for course
        userInputForTeacher - user input for teacher
        userInputForStart - user input for the start hour of the lesson
        userInputForStartMin - user input for the start minutes of the lesson
        userInputForEnd - user input for the end hour of the lesson
        userInputForEndMin - user input for the end minutes of the lesson
